bug.author: edwardyehuang
bug.summary: Need example of mixed precision in eager execution mode
bug.description:
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r1.14/api_docs/python/tf/train/experimental/enable_mixed_precision_graph_rewrite>https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r1.14/api_docs/python/tf/train/experimental/enable_mixed_precision_graph_rewrite</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r1.14/api_docs/python/tf/train/experimental/MixedPrecisionLossScaleOptimizer>https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r1.14/api_docs/python/tf/train/experimental/MixedPrecisionLossScaleOptimizer</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r1.14/api_docs/python/tf/keras/mixed_precision/experimental/LossScaleOptimizer>https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r1.14/api_docs/python/tf/keras/mixed_precision/experimental/LossScaleOptimizer</denchmark-link>
I have tried all of them. None of them worked for me in eager mode. Could you provide some examples?

comments.comment: Please have a look on <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/29241>#29241</denchmark-link> . PR for "enable_mixed_precision_graph_rewrite" is in queue. Thanks!
Sorry, my mistake. The tf.keras.Model.compile and tf.keras.Model.fit is still able to use in Eager Execution Mode. Close this issue now.
